title: mojo.rpc.AttributeContext.Peer
description:
This type defines attributes for a node that handles a network request.
The node can be either a service or an application that sends, forwards,
or receives the request. Service peers should fill in
`principal` and `labels` as appropriate.

ip.description: The IP address of the peer.

labels.description: The labels associated with the peer.

port.description: The network port of the peer.

principal.description:
The identity of this peer. Similar to `Request.auth.principal`, but
relative to the peer instead of the request. For example, the
idenity associated with a load balancer that forwared the request.

regionCode.description:
The CLDR country/region code associated with the above IP address.
If the IP address is private, the `region_code` should reflect the
physical location where this peer is running.
